fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While using custom images or images based on other images that don't have /tmp directory Pipelines builds will not display any log in its output

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an image with the command "rm -rf /tmp" on the Dockerfile or use an image that doesn't have this folder
 # Run a build on Pipelines using that image

h3. Expected Results

The builds on pipelines to display the results of the command ran.

h3. Actual Results

No output is available on the Bitbucket Pipelines UI besides the build set up and teardown.

h3. Workaround

1. Remove the `rm -rf /tmp` from the dockerfile or replace it with "rm -rf /tmp/*"
2. Create the folder "/tmp/*" on the root of the image
fields.summary: Pipelines doesn't render the build output if image being used doesn't have the "/tmp" root folder

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary During a parallel/multiple step Bitbucket Pipelines build, every step performs a git clone which takes time and defeats the purpose of having parallel execution

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a Pipelines build, which has multiple step
 
h3. Expected Results
Only the first step is doing the clone, for the second and third step the clone could be passed to another builds thus we could save build minutes
h3. Actual Results
Each step is is doing a clone
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Make the clone available for all the running steps

fields.description:
When a developer wants to create a JWT token for Bitbucket Cloud connect app that consumes a Bitbucket Cloud API 2.0, there's no example code about it in this document. - [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/understanding-jwt-for-apps/] (Under "Creating a JWT token")

Currently, the example code mentioned there is only for Jira.
It would very helpful to have an example for Bitbucket Cloud as well.
fields.summary: Add JWT token example for Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Currently, when developers used the [App descriptor|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/app-descriptor/] connection, it can also connect to Pipelines through an App password.

Now, the App descriptor doc says:
{quote}the full list of scopes is extensive and available at: [Bitbucket Cloud REST API scopes|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-cloud-rest-api-scopes/].
{quote}
However, going to the full list of scopes, there are no Pipelines scopes mentioned there.

Hence, it would great to add the Pipelines scopes information there as well. - [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-cloud-rest-api-scopes/]
fields.summary: Update REST API Documentation to include Pipelines scopes

fields.description:
Color for URL-marked line in a diff should be something else than grey. It makes very difficult to recognize the line that should be more evident to the eye.

Seems like the usual color for line highlighting when you use a link to a line of code is grey. This is OK when pointing to normal code (with white background). But if the line you're linking to is within a diff, then the grey gets lost and hard to notice. This would be worst for color blind people. Github uses a yellow color which has good contrast against the diff's red and green.
fields.summary: More distinctive colors for URL-marked line diffs

fields.description:
The way external access management works for Bitbucket is that a user creates an IAM User and attaches certain permissions to it. This allows the usage of IAM Users through ACCESS_KEY_ID and ACCESS_SECRET_KEY.

This leads to some disadvantages such as:

1- It forces the user to share long-term access keys.
2- It prevents your users from using what's called "keys rotation" - a security mechanism that changes credentials to resources that are defined by the user.
3- It prevents your users from controlling who really uses these keys.

The advantages of using IAM Roles improves the sections above:
1- Role-based authentication is session-based credentials rather than long-term.
2- It allows your users to rotate keys, meaning that even if the keys
are compromised, it's only temporary until they are replaced.
3- It allows your users to define which entities are allowed to use the role (e.g. a bitbucket role / AWS account which is associated with bitbucket / etc.).

As a suggestion, the setup between your user and a pipeline can be as follows:

1- Bitbucket creates on its behalf an AWS IAM Entity (IAM User / IAM
Role / etc.), and shares the ARN (ARN is the "amazon identifier"
for this IAM entity) and maybe another thing which is called "external_id"
in amazon terms.
2- Your users create an IAM Role, which allows only the entity from
step (1) to assume it.
3- Your users also attaches the desired permissions to their Role -
access to services such as ECS / ECR / Lambda to perform deployments, for
example.
4- In the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file, instead of giving the
access-key and secret-key (even if they are secured-variables), the user provides their IAM-Role ARN.
5- Bitbucket can now use this IAM-Role in order to perform requests on
behalf of your user, and yet no party needs to share any secrets with the
other.
fields.summary: Enable AWS IAM entities management through Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
HI,

In an environment with many users, showing the user's email address on the 'Users on Plan' page would be very useful to simplify Bitbucket administration.

This information is already shown on the group members page, so I think it is not so difficult to show in Users in the Plan as well.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Email address on Users on Plan

fields.description:
This is NOT about pipes and YAML alias and anchors.

We require to share the same/similar bitbucket-pipeline.yml files between repositories.

Requirements:
 * the build must be centrally managed 
 * the templates shall be able to be customized 
allow overriding variables
 * the solution shall not rely on maintaining docker images
 * A solution similar to gitlab-ci includes is preferable 
[https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/yaml/includes.html]
fields.summary: Allow bitbucket-pipeline templates to be manged and shared between multiple repositories

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket Pipelines only accepts vendor-provided pipes, which are listed as official pipes:  [https://bitbucket.org/product/features/pipelines/integrations].

It'd be great to allow also contributions from external users to share and reuse more pipes and increase the community. 

Please, feel free to use this feature request to share your pipes and your requirements and ideas about how you'd like it to be implemented.
fields.summary: Support for Community pipes

fields.description:
It would be interesting to have integrated artifact handling in Bitbucket cloud for enduser customers (e.g. in Downloads) for build artifacts (e.g. jar, exe, img, py, ...) with managed access.

As a developer I can publish artifact in this section (similar to any artifactory services) and define user account (not bitbucket accounts) with permission to login and download specific artifacts. 

I know there are other solutions (suggestions are also welcome in comments), but it would be great if this is integrated in Atlassian toolchain for small companies with just a few desktop applications.
fields.summary: Intergrate download management for customers

fields.description:
Currently, if a 'bot' account can access the Pipeline, it needs to claim a seat similar to a traditional user on the account.

Please allow the option to create a bot/pipeline-specific account that does not count towards the Bitbucket user total.

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-Pipelines-questions/Allow-CI-Pipeline-to-be-added-to-branch-permissions/qaq-p/1380522
fields.summary: Bot/pipeline specific account should not count towards user total count

fields.description: When requiring Jira Issue Keys on commit messages, this feature will also take place into commits made inside Pipelines. it would be great if users had the option to exclude this requirement for commits made inside a build.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude pipelines from requiring Jira Issue key on commit messages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

bitbucket-pipelines.yml doesn't respond after a few mins of inactivity
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open bitbucket-pipelines.yml file in the Pipeline editor in UI
 # Change a couple of characters in the main content textbox. Leave the cursor inside the textbox.
 # Go away from the editor for 3-4 mins
 # Come back to the editor and hit a key on the keyboard. The content editor disappears and is replaced by a perpetual loading screen.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to update the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file and previous changes should be preserved
h3. Actual Results

The content editor disappears and is replaced by a perpetual loading screen.
h3. Workaround

Copy bitbucket-pipelines.yml file from the web editor into a local text editor, copy the changes, and commit
fields.summary: bitbucket-pipelines.yml doesn't respond after some inactivity

fields.description: Please provide the ability to filter comments by other users on pull requests. Currently, you are only able to search/filter your own comments or all comments (cannot specify another user from yourself).
fields.summary: Option to filter by user on PR comments

fields.description:
Hi,

In {{Crucible}} I could see new unread comments in grey, which is a different color than comments I already read.

I could also mark a comment as 'unread' if I wanted to read it later, and mark a file as 'unread' for the same purpose.

This functionality is lacking from Bitbucket cloud which makes it really hard to keep track of which comments were read and which files were reviewed.

This {{Crucible}} feature is necessary for code reviewing.

Please relate.
fields.summary: Comment and file tracking as in Crucible

fields.description:
Currently, the Pull Request API call states the following:
 "Creates a new pull request where the destination repository is this repository and the author is the authenticated user."
 * [Link|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests#post]

We would like it to be possible to either modify this API call to allow Pull Request to be created between repositories (forked) or to have a new one under the [Fork endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/forks] with this option.

(i) Currently, it is only possible to create Pull Requests between repositories using the UI but its not supported with the available API endpoints.
fields.summary: Fork Pull Request API call

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to restrict users that are managed under the same organization from changing their username.

This is important as, if a given account is used for authentication on a third-party service, it will not allow any further authentication attempts due to the incorrect username if it was changed and the third-party service was not updated to reflect this change.
fields.summary: Restrict username changes on managed Bitbucket accounts

fields.description:
While migrating to Bitbucket Cloud, if there are failed builds, they cannot be edited without using the API end point 
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/

Or opening their old build platform. 

Ideally a feature to bulk update build status via UI would help migrating customers.
fields.summary: Bulk Update Build Status
Change snippet raw URL on the UI to match the API by removing the "!" character

fields.description:
When a PR is about to be merged, the user is presented with the merge dialog. If there are Jira tickets associated with the change, then user can perform ticket transition directly from the merge dialog.

However, the field that shows ticket status is too narrow. The dropdown list with available status is too narrow to be useful, as well.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Transition issue status field is too narrow

fields.description:
Accidentally making a repository public could be a security incident. It should be done more carefully.
It would be great if the dialog like "Do you really want to make repository public?" is shown when a private repository is changed to public.
fields.summary: Show dialog when making a repository public from private.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By default, in Pull review view, Bitbucket should show the build status (when applicable) on the commit view and under "Build passed" section of the code review.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # It affects only some users, where others will be the build status on commits on PR view
 # The repository must have build integration either Pipelines or any 3rd party tool using Bitbucket API to update build status
 # Open an existing Open or Merged PR > expand Commits section >see there is no build status agains the commit
 # Now click into each commit individually, from the commit view in the top right corner you'll see see that the there is a build status populated on there

h3. Expected Results

To see build status on Pull request commits view and on the Details panel under "build passed"
h3. Actual Results

No build status is shown on the commits view or in the details panel view on the Pull request view
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On Bitbucket Cloud cod review screen in some cases the build status is not shown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Bitbucket Cloud UI, when you try to edit a file with .j2 extension(example: test.j2), the spinner keeps spinning and you cannot edit the file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a file with .j2 extension. For example test.j2
 # Open the file on the UI and click on the Edit button to edit the file.
 # The spinner keeps spinning and you cannot edit the file

h3. Expected Results

When you click on the Edit button, you should be able to edit the file.
h3. Actual Results

When you click on the Edit button, the spinner keeps spinning and you cannot edit the file.
h3. Workaround

Edit .j2 files locally rather than via the source editor
fields.summary: Cannot edit files with .j2 extension

fields.description:
When creating a pull request, the diff is loaded automatically against the default PR branch. 

Instead of this, it would be better if the diff did not get loaded until the user had selected *both* branches themselves. 

This avoids the issue where you have large diffs causing the page to freeze, because you are working on a feature that is not yet ready to merge into the main branch.
fields.summary: Do not load diff when creating PRs until user has selected both branches

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Private repository setting is wrongly shown as unchecked when it's opened from Jira. If a user clicks [Save changes] as it is, it makes the repository public unintendedly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# open pull request from Jira
#*   !image-2021-02-26-16-45-36-737.png|thumbnail! 
# go to [Repository settings] - [Repository details]
# check [Access level] - [This is a private repository]

h3. Expected Results
It shows "This is a private repository" as checked

h3. Actual Results
It shows "This is a private repository" as unchecked
*  !image-2021-02-26-16-44-46-516.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Workaround
Refresh the repo settings page and It shows "This is a private repository" as checked correctly.
fields.summary: Private repository setting is wrongly shown as unchecked when it's opened from Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We're investigating an issue where comments are not rendered in the Bitbucket UI and are listed as having been left on a line that doesn't exist. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue happens intermittently - potentially only when adding a comment to an empty line. We're still investigating steps to reliably reproduce the problem and will update this when we know more. 
h3. Expected Results

The comment is consistently displayed on the line it was left on
h3. Actual Results

The comment is not rendered and is shown in the activity feed as having been added to a line that does not exist. 
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Commenting on empty lines at the end of files can cause the comment to move to a line that doesn't exist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Merges are sometimes incorrectly attributed and/or have multiple notifications sent out
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # as this is not happening all the time, no known steps to reproduce this issue

h3. Expected Results

For notifications to reflect correct user who merged the PR
h3. Actual Results

Sometimes we would see in notifications a wrong user who did the merge instead of the actual user who "Closed" the PR
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Merge notifications are sometimes incorrectly attributed

fields.description:
In the option  Settigs -> Access Controls -> Add or remove IP addresses

Add a description field for each IP addreess, so it can be easier for security administrators to manage and keep the list updated
fields.summary: Add a description field for each IP address in the Access controls option

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to manage which users/groups can access specific files within a given repository.
Additionally, when files that have this limitation imposed on them are altered, send an e-mail notification to the admins of the repo to confirm the file has been changed.
fields.summary: Access management for specific files

fields.description: Currently, the users having Atlassian access can sign up to the Bitbucket account. It would be great for org admins to have an option to disable the same.
fields.summary: Provide an option to disable user sign up for Bitbucket accounts

fields.description:
Some organizations don't want users to commit to the repositories in their workspace with an external email address that is outside their company email domain.

Feature request:
It would be great to have a feature or settings that will prevent users from adding an email address as an alias that is not in the claimed domain list of that organization.
fields.summary: Restrict users from adding alias email from outside their organisation domain

fields.description:
When some file is moved across repositories and two different PRs are open, the moved file can be easily be compared when Bitbucket displays a HASH of file contents.

 

(It might have other use cases as well which i am not aware.)
fields.summary: File Hash displayed in PRs to compare manually  with a file in another PR

fields.description:
*Current behavior:* 

when you create an in-line comment on a PR a new record is created in the Activity feed. 

Other users would add more comments or tasks and they all appear in chronological order with latest at the top.  

When somebody replies to the old comment - we currently bump that old comment to the top of the Activity feed, which can be confusing. 

*Suggested change:* 

preserve the order of comments in the order they were added and keep the original comment where it was but show the link under it that more comments were added.
fields.summary: In the Pull Request Activity Feed - do not reorder comments once a reply is added to an older inline comment

fields.description:
Need to have an option for skipping the steps in pipeline based on condition.

In our case, we need to choose the type of deployment in pipeline which is manual parallel steps.
After running either deployment step, sequential step has to get executed . 

It allows to run the sequential step only after the both steps in parallel is executed succesfully.

My suggestion here is to have a  SKIP button similar to RUN in manual step.
fields.summary: Skip steps based on condition - Include SKIP and RUN on manual steps

fields.description:
Currently, if you have lots of files in a pull request, you'll have to navigate to the *Files* tab to view those files.
 You can scroll using your mouse wheel or computer touchpad scroll.
 However, there is no visible scroll bar for the *Files* tab.

*Feature enhancement:*
 It would be very useful to have a vertical scroll bar visible on the *Files* tab for control and visibility over all files you can navigate
fields.summary: Pull request Files tab scroll bar

fields.description:
At the moment users can push changes using an email that is not mapped to an Atlassian account. 

Users can make changes to their local Git configuration to use a different username and email that is different than their primary Atlassian/Bitbucket Cloud email. If the email used in their local Git configuration is not set as an email alias on Bitbucket Cloud, the commits they push will not be linked to any accounts. 

This can appear concerning as it looks like a random individual pushed changes but in actuality, they are an authorized user.
fields.summary: Option to prevent unmapped users from pushing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating a pull request in the Firefox browser, the "Close branch" checkbox is disabled(not clickable). 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new branch and make a commit on the branch
 # Go to the Branches page for the repository
 # Click on the "Create" link to create a pull request
 # The "Close branch" checkbox is disabled

h3. Expected Results

The "Close branch" checkbox should be clickable.
h3. Actual Results

The "Close branch" checkbox is disabled/not clickable. 
h3. Workaround
 * Click on the text labels to the sides of the checkbox to enable the checkbox.
 * Or use a different browser
fields.summary: The "Close branch" checkbox is not working properly in Firefox browser.

fields.description:
Currently, the Bitbucket pipeline does not support GPU architecture build. Our current infrastructure doesn't come with GPU.

It would be great if we can support GPU architecture build in the future.

Customer mention:
{quote}
I think it's really time for Bitbucket to look into this gap. As the world
becomes more AI-empowered, the need to support compute-intensive GPU
applications are set to increasingly pick up the pace.
{quote}
fields.summary: Support pipeline build in GPU architecture

fields.description: Currently, we do not have the functionality to disable SSH keys for a workspace, It would be great for the organization admins to have a feature that would help to disable SSH key creation for certain users.
fields.summary: Allow Organization admins to disable SSH keys

fields.description:
In recent times, I think the style of the merge form is changed.
While submitting, I think should add space to the left of the loading icon.
Thank you for reading my suggestion.

!image-2021-02-23-09-18-04-436.png!
fields.summary: Should update the style of the merge PR form

fields.description:
While using the Premium feature IP Whitelisting we would like to be able to customize how it affects our workspace and users. eg.
# We would like to enforce the IP Whitelisting to SSH connections only (since we have 2FA enforced)
# We would like to be able to bypass the IP Whitelisting feature while using the UI
# We would like it to be possible to whitelist the MAC address instead of the IP address
fields.summary: Ability to customize how Premium feature IP Whitelisting works

fields.description:
When reviewing a PR, we need the ability to quickly see what tasks are left.  Comments are awesome and contextual, but it's not easy to get a quick "at a glance" idea of what's remaining for the developer to resolve.

Can we change the sorting on the details panel so that Tasks can be listed first? 

Could we also consider adding a task counter to the list when viewing all PRs in a repository?
fields.summary: Custom Sorting of Pull Request Details Panel

fields.description:
On the Pipelines home page, the button "What's new" button is constantly showing upon clicking.

*Feature request:*
Some users preferred not to show it on the home page constantly.
If we could add it inside the help (?) result, that would be awesome.
fields.summary: Remove What's new button after clicking on Pipelines home page

fields.description: It is too hard to see what files have changed.
fields.summary: I really dislike the new Bitbucket view

fields.description:
Currently, it is possible to set different indentation configurations when editing markdown files (2,4 or 8). However, as a standard, markdown always expects 4 spaces in order to set a new indentation level. For example:
{code:java} 
- MainBullet
  - sub point A
  - sub point B
{code}

Since it is using two spaces per indentation, it will be rendered as:
* MainBullet
* sub point A
* sub point B

It would be great if our markdown preview would also support two spaces for indentation levels, instead of always four.
fields.summary: Support different indentation spaces for markdown files

fields.description:
Right now, the only way (at least that I know of) to define step specific variables is to use deployments, but sometimes it might be useful to define variables for non-deployment steps as well. Defining some environment variables inside bitbucket-pipelines.yml for any step would be really useful for writing re-usable steps when using YAML anchors.

In our use case, we have a monorepo that contains frontend code, backend code, iac code etc. and we use build flags to build multiple applications from the same source code and deploy each of them to separate cloud environments, all from the same branch. Because there's no easy way to re-use our step definitions, there's a lot of duplication in the pipelines configuration that could be easily reduced if we could pass env variables to steps.

Here's a simplified example and a suggestion for syntax:
{code:java}
image: atlassian/default-image:2

definitions:
  steps:
    - step: &build
        name: build
        script:
          - ./install
          - ./lint
          - ./test
          - ./build $BUILD_TARGET

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        name: Build (target 1)
        env:
          - BUILD_TARGET: 'build-target-1'
        <<: *build
    - step:
        name: Build (target 2)
        env:
          - BUILD_TARGET: 'build-target-2'
        <<: *build
{code}
fields.summary: Add support for step-specific environment variables
Allow multiple use of "deployment" in Pipelines steps

fields.description: Currently, the pull request notification email has only the Pull request number, title, and repository name. It would be really helpful to the reviewers if the source and destination branch names are included in the notification email.
fields.summary: Add source and destination branch names in the pull request notification email

fields.description:
Hi There! 

It takes time to get an initial pipeline script up and working, and doing this should not count toward the build minutes of actually using pipelines.

The pipeline runner also takes its own time to cache steps for faster execution, however this takes up a lot of time (in my case over 4 minutes just to cache one step). This should not take up build minutes.

50 build minutes is very low for a free plan, as a team with only a few  (<< 10) people could easily consume that. Given the free plan has 10 users, the amount should be comparable to such a team. 

Cheers

Leif
fields.summary: Build minutes should exclude automatic cache time and should have minutes for initial setup of scripts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Activity feed shows the oldest commit's updated date instead of most recent commit's date under the commits section on the right hand side panel.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Open any pull request.
- Goto the Activity feed and filter by commits.
 !image-2021-02-17-20-20-03-410.png|thumbnail! 
- In the above screenshot, the updated date is 2021-01-26(Which is taken from the oldest commit id - 7f00f3b) whereas the most recent commit id is 4552075 which was updated 7 hours ago as per the below screenshot.
 !image-2021-02-17-20-47-25-682.png|thumbnail! 
 - This shows a discrepancy on how the last updated date is being shown in different sections on the same page.

h3. Actual Results
- Last updated date under commit's section doesn't match the last updated date under the activity feed and makes it unreliable to follow the last updated date on activity feed. 

h3. Expected Results
- Last updated date on the activity feed to match the last updated date of the most recent 
 from commit section of the PR.

h3. Workaround

- To follow the last updated from the commits section of the PR.
fields.summary: Activity feed shows the oldest commit's updated date instead of most recent commit's date
Warning error when adding a wrong exclude wildcards

fields.description:
It would be good to have a way to tag a source commit while approving the PR.  And also a merge checks to validate if a tag is present.

*Example:*

when a user clicks on *approve* on the pull request, the user should get a pop-up that allows the user to tag a commit and also a merge check to validate if the tags are present.
fields.summary: Allow users to tag a source commit while approving the PR and add a merge check to validate the tags

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clinking on the build result in the commit/pull request while holding the cmd/ctrl key doesn't open a new tab like the other hyperlinks on the same page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a commit page that has a Bitbucket Pipelines build linked to it
 # While using MacOS, press cmd + click on the build result

h3. Expected Results

A new tab should be opened

h3. Actual Results

The commit page is redirected to the build page



h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: When "cmd/ctrl + click" on the build result link no new tab is open

fields.description:
Issue Summary
Users does not appear in the 'User picker'(reviewers) list while creating a PR

Steps to Reproduce
1. Click "create pull request"
2. start typing user names to add team members to reviewers list

Expected Results
The users should be listed in the reviewers' search

Actual Results

The users are not listed in the reviewers' search
 
Workaround

Update:
Using the API call below, it is possible to add users after the Pull Request is created:
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/rest/api-group-pullrequests/#api-repositories-workspace-repo-slug-default-reviewers-target-username-put
fields.summary: Users does not appear in the 'User picker'(reviewers) list while creating a PR in some situations
Accurate Error log in Pipelines during Custom image usage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket resolves workspace and repository UUIDs to their slugs in the URL only for the root page of the repository. Same mechanism should be applied when visiting any other page of the repository.

One of the scenarios is navigating from the Jira development panel to Bitbucket Cloud using the commit/pull request/branch/build/deployment: the links in dev panel use UUIDs of the repository.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue's page on Jira
 # From the right-hand sidebar, under the "Development" field, click on pull request/commit/deployments (or any other option)
 # From the overlaying window click on any pull request (or other options) listed in the table
 # The navigation URL uses UUID which doesn't get resolved to the repository name

h3. Expected Results

The redirection from Jira to Bitbucket Cloud should resolve the UUIDs to human-readable repository names
h3. Actual Results

Currently, UUID doesn't seem to resolve to the repository name
h3. Workaround

The UUID resolves to repository name after navigating to other options on Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: Resolve workspace and repository UUIDs to slugs

fields.description:
Merge conflict can happen at any time during the development process. At the moment we do provide users with [detailed guidance|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/resolve-merge-conflicts/] on how to address merge conflicts when they attempt to merge a pull request that contains conflicts.

However, when users attempt to resolve merge conlfics in other areas such as syncing a branch. A pop-up appears with instructions but the instructions are not as detailed 

For example, the pop-up that appears when attempting to sync a branch that contains merge conflicts
!image-2021-02-12-10-58-36-220.png|thumbnail! 

There are no instructions on what to do after the branch is merged locally. How should a user push the changes back to the remote repository? 

It would be useful if we can provide additional details on the next steps to close the loop.
fields.summary: Additional guidance to address merge conflicts

fields.description:
Bitbucket pull requests allow me to collapse files as I read them, which allows me to filter out the things I've already seen and considered.

Allow collapse in a similar way when viewing the branch. The user should be able to show/hide files. It would also be great to be able to be able to do it while the top of the file has gone past the top of the viewport in a way similar to the "sticky" file names in PRs.
fields.summary: Allow file collapse when viewing branch diff

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whe you edit a PR or issue that contains a link in a bullet list, the link is lost.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a PR or Issue
# Add a link with custom text (cmd + k on macOS)
# Create the entity (PR/Issue)
# Edit the entity - needs to really change some text on the editor.
# Observe that the links created no longer have the tooltip to 'Edit link' when hovered over
# Save the entity

h3. Expected Results
Entity is edited with success. Links are preserved.

h3. Actual Results
Links inside the bullet list are lost.


h3. Workaround
Add links outside bullet list.
fields.summary: Link is lost when editing bullet lists on PRs and Issues

fields.description:
It Might be a specificity of our pull request process but I still have some request in case it makes sense on a more larger context.
For us it is the responsability of the reviewer to validate the pull request tasks and not the author. So for a clear way to know what status the task is in, as author and once the task is done we edit the task with a "*" which means that te task is "Done and to be checked by the reviewer".
The reviewer then needs to look for the tasks with a "*" and check them when they are effectively done.
Note that the author could check the task and the reviewer delete it, but we like to keep track of the process and this would not allow it. Whether leaving a comment without a task, which looks like an oversight or remove the comment altogether which would erase the pull request history.

*In Short:*
Right now there is no clear way to know whose turn it is to work on the PR: The reviewer or the author. And that is where the feature request comes.
You recently added the "request change" status on the PR from the reviewer side, we would like for the author to be able to change this status with a "change are done and can be reviewed again" clearly visible in the pull request list.

*Side note:*
A clear way to do the same on the pull request task would be also a great help, editing with a "*" is not really a nice and flowy process. A three status tasks would be very helpful: "to be done by author", "done by author need checking by reviewer", "checked by reviewer and validated"
fields.summary: Allow Pull Request author to mark changes as "done and can be reviewed again"

fields.description:
Hello, I have attached a screenshot of my problem. I do not mean to be snarky, but as soon as one of my pipeline builds fails, a popup appears that blocks the actual log, makes some worthless suggestions, and has the gall to ask "is this helpful?"

I am sorry but I am trying to troubleshoot a pipeline issue and this popup is frankly infuriating. You know what would be helpful? Being able to read the ****ing pipeline log instead of having to dismiss this worthless popup. I am really sorry, but I like your product and I just need to vent. I need someone to hear me about how frustrating this is. Please make it stop! This popup is an anti-feature.

In the meantime I will write a greasemonkey script to get rid of it, but I would much rather solve problems that actually matter to my project than have to patch your UI. Thank you for your patience.
fields.summary: The troubleshooting popup when a pipeline build fails blocks the error log

fields.description: In Github, users can add a '1s' after 'github' in any repo url to preview it in VS code - this would be great to have in Bitbucket as well.
fields.summary: Ability to add '1s' to a repo URL to preview it in VS code

fields.description: Currently, there is no webhook event in Bitbucket Cloud for the "Request changes" action in a PR. Kindly add this webhook event.
fields.summary: Add "Request Changes" Webhook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Bitbucket Cloud Swagger (OpenAPI) document validation errors at https://editor.swagger.io/

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy Swagger from https://bitbucket.org/api/swagger.json
 # Paste it in validation page at https://editor.swagger.io/

h3. Expected Results
No Validation errors
h3. Actual Results
Lots of Validation errors
 !Screenshot 2021-02-10 at 7.49.29 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No Workaround available at this moment, will update if there's any.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud Swagger (OpenAPI) document validation errors

fields.description:
My companies PR process is:
 # Submit a PR
 # Senior dev makes comments in BB
 # I go through their comments and make the suggested changes.

What I usually do is add a reply to their comment with just "Done". So that I have a record of what's been addressed. Creating a Jira ticket is too cumbersome. I'd like it if BB either had a little checkbox next to each comment, or even better if you had some way for me to just read the comments (and code line) as a checklist...and then let me check them off one by one. I don't want my dev to be getting tons of emails, but at the same time I want them to see as I address each issue.
fields.summary: Pull Request comments checklist

fields.description:
With GIT, it is possible to tell when merging a branch whether you want to overwrite the changes and which branch files you want to keep as the final product.

However, in Bitbucket Pull Request, it is only possible to merge using fast-forward, commit, or squash without the possibility of adding options as the commands are hardcoded. So this means that it is required to pull the changes locally and resolve the merge conflicts before they can be merged within the UI.

The ask there is to allow user to select which changes should take precedence when there is merge conflict in PR on BB UI.
fields.summary: Allow pull requests to be merged regardless of merge conflicts

fields.description:
The current wording around Overages makes it sound like the upcoming minutes/storage is free
 !image-2021-02-09-18-37-05-046.png|thumbnail! 

Kindly edit this to be more specific about paid overages..
Eg: 5 GB remaining until you can opt in for overages

(or something better).
fields.summary: Paid Account Plan Details Message

fields.description:
Repository Links with more than 6 characters are redirecting the user to https://bitbucket.org/<WorkspaceName>/<RepoName>/commits/<TaskId> instead of the actual link. 

*Note:* this works fine when the links are in the format "-12345678", however, the problem arises only when using a colon like ":12345678".
fields.summary: Problem with repository link

fields.description:
Currently, if a private workspace is accessed publicly, the landing page will say something like:
 !private_workspace_landingpage.png!

The landing page still implies that the private workspace exists

*Feature Request:*
 If a workspace is private, it would be best not to give hints about it or at least show the 404 landing page as below:
 !404_landing_page.png|width=529,height=363!
fields.summary: Private workspace landing page still gives a hint that a private workspace exist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The user is unable to search reviewer in a new fork PR merge. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Fork a repositories
 # Create a PR and search reviewer user from the main repositories

h3. Expected Results
* User is able to search for users from the main repo in the PR reviewer

h3. Actual Results
* User is unable to search any user from the main repo in the PR reviewer

Note
* When creating PR (the PR yet to create) the web URL is on the private fork repo which that reviewer has no access which might be the reason why it's not showing. However, when the PR is created it's created on the main repo hence the user is able to search for the reviewer because the user is in the main repo.

h3. Workaround
* Create the PR first and add the reviewer later by editing the PR
fields.summary: User is unable to search reviewer in a new fork PR merge.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, if you use the Deployments Environment API 2.0, it gives an invalid URL for the "next" parameter for pagination.
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/environments/#get]

Apart from that, using the *pagelen* parameter to the above API is also not working as expected because it always loads everything regardless of the value of the *pagelen* parameter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the CURL command below:
{code:java}
curl -sL -u bb_username:app_password "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/workspace_id/repo_name/environments/"
{code}
Generate an [App password|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/app-passwords/] for authentication.

 # Notice the result
{code:java}
{"page" : 1,
"values"[...],
"pagelen" : 13,
"size" : 13,
"next" : "https://SOME_INVALID_DOMAIN_HERE/rest/2.0/accounts/SOME_ID/repositories/SOME_ID/environments?page=2&pagelen=10"}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

* The "next" parameter will give the correct API host domain (e.g. {{[https://api.bitbucket.org|https://api.bitbucket.org/]}}).
* If there are no more results there should be no next link
* The next link should have the correct hostname and path
* When following the next link, the correct page should be returned
* If a limit is provided, the number of results returned should not exceed the limit

h3. Actual Results

The "next" parameter is showing an invalid API host domain
{noformat}
"next" : "https://SOME_INVALID_DOMAIN_HERE/rest/2.0/accounts/SOME_ID/repositories/SOME_ID/environments?page=2&pagelen=10"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

For now, we can ignore the "next" parameter for this API then load everything in one API call.
 To make sure we load everything, please use the *pagelen=100* parameter.
{code:java}
curl -sL -u bb_username:app_password "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/workspace_id/repo_name/environments/?pagelen=100"
{code}
fields.summary: Consuming the Deployments Environments API 2.0 is giving an invalid next parameter URL

fields.description: We have build output automatically added as comments to our PRs that is sometimes thousands of lines long; this makes scrolling through the comments quite tedious. It would be really swell to be able to collapse/expand individual comments, or all comments so one can more easily sift through and drill down to relevant text.
fields.summary: Add functionality to expand/collapse PR comments
When deleting deployment environment's variables, the confirmation box is rendered at the top of the screen on Safari 14.0 onwards

fields.description:
As stated on ticket [BSERV-11639|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-11639], our company would like to have support for partial git clones. I will paraphrase the same arguments stated for Bitbucket Server.
h3. Problem Definition

A user needs to clone a large repository. If a user needs to work in a certain subdirectory of the repository, they are required to clone the entire repository. When a repository is large (Example: 1GB+) it can take some time to clone files that may not be required.
h3. Suggested Solution

Since Git 2.18, Git protocol v2 has introduced the --filter flag to enable [partial clones|https://github.com/git/git/blob/v2.19.0/Documentation/technical/partial-clone.txt]

This will allow users to clone specific subdirectories of a repository only.
h3. Why this is important

This will increase cloning performance on large repositories.
fields.summary: Add support for partial git clones (git clone --filter)

fields.description:
Show what reviewers have approved in the pull request commit list.

Currently the Pull Request view does not show what commits have been approved, but if you go to the commits tab of the project, you can see what commits have been approved.
fields.summary: Pull Request commit by commit approve

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Customer is trying to attach a pull request or branch to a card but nothing happens.
* Users should see a green or red icon indicating the build status of that pull request or branch.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Bitbucket Cloud power up to Trello
 # Attach a pull request from Bitbucket
 # Look for the Bitbucket Cloud repository to connect 
 # Select the repository 

h3. Expected Results
* The card should be connected to a pull request and the status is shown

h3. Actual Results
* No status is shown

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud power up for Trello is not reflecting PR or branch status on Trello card

fields.description:
With the current Exclude File feature in a Pull Request, it excludes the diff from loading but does not exclude the file from being in the PR list. 

With the PR file list limits being at 999 files, if we could remove excluded files from loading, we could give capacity for the other non-excluded files to load before hitting the limits. 

Suggestion is to : Completely not load the files that match the excluded file feature, so they don't show up as part of the diff as well as the file list. 

We could also probably put a banner saying, excluded files aren't displayed in the PR. (This is to avoid confusion of wether the file is part of the merge or not)
fields.summary: Remove files  from  loading in the PR that match excluded files

fields.description:
Currently, there's no way to group branches into folders to declutter the branch view to better manage developer workflow.

*Feature request:*
It would be useful to be able to group branches into folders.
It would also help to archive long term branches.
fields.summary: Group branches into folders

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Very rarely Pipeline build keeps running for a long duration even the steps inside the build complete successfully. Later on the build complete with the following error -
{code:java}
Configuration error
The pipeline has entered an unknown state. Please rerun or contact support.
{code}

Due to a very rare condition PENDING step is incorrectly time-out and marked as NOT_RUN while other step is still running, causing the pipeline to enter an unknown state

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the Pipeline build and observe it

h3. Expected Results

The Pipeline build complete within the expected time
h3. Actual Results

The Pipeline build keep running for a long time but the steps inside the build complete successfully within the expected time
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
 The good news is the build completes automatically after some time with "Configuration error" and users are not charged for the extra build duration.
fields.summary: Pipeline intermittently keep running for long time and complete with "Configuration error"

fields.description: It would be useful to have an endpoint that will list every group that the user is a member of in a workspace.
fields.summary: API endpoint for listing all the groups that user belongs to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the user is not a reviewer and it's their first time viewing the Pull Request page with 1280x720 resolution and below, they will need to zoom out in order to get the "Got it" button within their view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into an account that has never accessed the Pull Request page
# Create or access a Pull Request with reviewers (other users, not you)
#* Ensure that you are using 1280x720 resolution or below.
# Check the pop-up about changes to the Pull Request reviewers

h3. Expected Results

The pop-up button "Got it" be available 
 !image-2021-02-04-11-39-01-436.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The pop-up button "Got it" is unavailable 

 !image-2021-02-04-11-39-59-630.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use your browser option to zoom-out the page, as doing so you will be able to see and click the "Got it" button
fields.summary: Pop-ups on the Pull Request page are not visible with low-resolution monitors
Dropdown to Delete LFS files is rendering out of the screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create an existing project under a workspace, initially, the *Workspace* dropdown is selected to the correct workspace id.
 However, when you click *Create project* (with the existing Name and Key), the *Workspace* dropdown will be refreshed and selected to a different workspace id.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a workspace > Click Projects > Click *Create project* - [https://bitbucket.org/account/projects/create?workspace=workspace_id]
 (i) Notice that the parameter workspace matches the *Workspace* dropdown
 !project_pre_create.png|width=700,height=413!
 # Enter an existing project Name and Key
 # Click *Create project*
 (i) Notice the *Workspace* dropdown selection is pointing to a different workspace now
 !project_post_create.png|width=700,height=413!

h3. Expected Results

The *Workspace* dropdown will be pointing to a different workspace
h3. Actual Results

The *Workspace* dropdown is pointing to a different workspace
h3. Workaround

For now, we can manually set the dropdown to the correct workspace
fields.summary: Creating an existing project under a workspace points the Workspace dropdown to a different workspace id

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While creating a Pull Request, users are intermittently experiencing the "Close branch" checkbox to already be checked instead of being unchecked as the default behavior. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a pull request
 # Watch the "Close branch" checkbox is checked 

h3. Expected Results
The "Close branch" checkbox is unchecked.
h3. Actual Results
The "Close branch" checkbox is checked.

h3. Workaround

Based on the requirement, the user can keep it checked or manually uncheck the checkbox.
fields.summary: During the pull request creation sometimes the "Close branch" checkbox is default checked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While creating a new Jira instance while on Bitbucket issue migration prevents the user from picking the Jira instance name, it creates a generic Jira instance based on the User full name. Also, if that name is taken, the instance name gets created with random numbers within the name.
E.G:
https://felipe-ranghetti-stefanelli628.atlassian.net/onboarding/software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Bitbucket issues on the workspace settings
 # Create a Bitbucket issue within a repository
 # Go to "Import & Export" inside the workspace settings
 # Click on Start Migration
 # Select "Create a new site"
 # Click "Try now" for Jira software
 # Click "Start trial"
 # Select any workspace
 # Skip
 # At this point, the Jira instance is already being created without the possibility to enter the name of it. If you perform the steps twice, it will add random numbers to the new jira instance you attempt to create.

h3. Expected Results
Ask for the Jira instance name which is being created
h3. Actual Results
An instance is created based on the name of the user doing the migration.

h3. Workaround

Create the Jira instance before performing the Bitbucket Issue migration to Jira.
fields.summary: Creating a new Jira instance while on Bitbucket issue migration prevents the user from picking the Jira instance name

fields.description:
I think that the code review should be submitted to the requester instead of sending all comments in "real-time".

This way the requester will receive all suggestions at the same time, and besides, it will be possible to create a feature to show just the changes made after the code review, reducing the scope of the second revision and so on.
fields.summary: Submit code review and show just changed files on the second revision

fields.description: It would be very useful on the dashboard/home to see the last few worked in branches with a quick create PR link.
fields.summary: Add a list of the last 5 worked in branched to the dashboard/home view with a Create PR link

fields.description: Do we have any API which we can use to delete the commit(s) from the remote branch without checking out the code locally?
fields.summary: API to delete lastCommit(s)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Branch Restriction premium checkboxes are not clickable

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check/Uncheck any of the Premium features checkboxes

h3. Expected Results
The checkbox should be checked/unchecked after clicking on the checkbox
h3. Actual Results
The checkboxes are not clickable

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to click the lozenge/text instead of the checkbox.
fields.summary: Branch Restriction premium checkboxes are not clickable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have a branch name with an emoji then set it as the main branch, the commits under it are not viewable on Bitbucket Cloud UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a new or existing repo, create a new branch with the flag emoji e.g.: DEV-AU-🇦🇺
# Clone the repo and push a commit to the branch: DEV-AU-🇦🇺
# Change the main branch to: DEV-AU-🇦🇺
# Open the commit on Bitbucket Cloud UI

h3. Expected Results
The commit will still be viewable

h3. Actual Results
The commit is not viewable on Bitbucket Cloud UI

h3. Workaround
Unsetting the branch (with the emoji name) as the main branch makes the commits visible on BB UI again.
fields.summary: Setting a branch name with emoji as main branch breaks commits under it while accessing on the UI

fields.description:
At the moment we give users the ability to review active Bitbucket Cloud sessions.

Personal settings > Sessions

However this it's only available for review, it would be more useful if users can end active sessions remotely.
fields.summary: End active sessions remotely

fields.description:
Currently I have to manually resize the right panel by dragging it. If I don't drag it far enough out, it stays collapsed and vice versa. While it's a nice feature, it's inconvenient to use constantly. 

Can it minimize like the left panel does with the arrow (outlined in red).

!image-2021-02-01-17-43-30-219.png!
fields.summary: Allow for the right side menu in the new PR view to also be collaspable

fields.description:
Summary:
On the new PR experience, when clicking on the "commits" tab to check the commit message, the maximum number of displayed characters for each commit is 30. The largest size a commit message would be before it would be truncated is 50, diminishing functionality on the new PR experience
If the commit message has more than 30 characters, the commit message will be truncated to display only the first 30 characters (20 characters if the sidebar is not collapsed).

This bug is to change this behavior to be like the old PR experience, where it was capable of displaying up to 50 characters, taking advantage of screen space.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to a PR on the new PR experience.
2. You will be able to notice that the commits shown on the commits dropdown which have more than 30 characters will be truncated.

Workarounds:
The workaround for this is to hover your mouse over the commit message in order to display the entire message.
fields.summary: Commit tab in the new PR experience shows a limited number of characters

fields.description:
The "days ago" is often unclear as to which day is is. It will use 24-hour periods (apparently) so late one day is the same day as early the next. That's a bug, but it'd be most clear to just give the day and date: "Fri. Jan 11th." Adding time may be good, too.

 

Giving the actual date is most clear. This is helpful for reviewing recent actions for creating work reports. Going to the raw data for individual commits to find the date is unneeded work.
fields.summary: On the commits tab, show actual date and not "days ago."

fields.description:
Ability to customise what aspects are copied to a clipboard in certain situations, for example, here, the ability to just copy the branch details (without including "checkout") to help speed up daily work. 
 !image-2021-02-01-16-51-20-447.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customise Copy to Clipboard

fields.description: Initially Bitbucket included a tab for the user to see commits specific to that pull request. With the latest update, this useful tab has been removed and now the user has to go to 'Activity' tab where every activity is displayed. With this, if the user still wants to go over the commits in a (latest commits first) order, it would be very difficult and time consuming. Can we have a separate tab as before for Commits only?
fields.summary: Add a tab/option for the user to see history of commits in the pull request in an ordered list

fields.description: For history purposes, it would be great if we could copy a repository preserving its code history as well as pull requests, comments, and issues.
fields.summary: Ability to copy a repository preserving all git entities and metadata

fields.description: The repos vars have a name and value, but I'd also like to add a short description for why/where they are being used.
fields.summary: Add description to repository variables

fields.description: The variables are in a random or creation time order. I'd like to be able to sort these values in alphabetical order to be able to read through them more quickly
fields.summary: Sort repository variables in alphabetical order

fields.description:
It would be useful to set up a sort of baseline setting so that we can protect our master branches en masse. For example, having just migrated from Bitbucket Server, our repositories no longer have their configurations, so many of them have a master branch that is exposed to direct writes. It was frustrating to find that they would all have to manually be configured.

I think, in the interest of making migration easier, and also making it easier to establish a protocol for all of the developers in a workspace, some more global way of configuring repositories is necessary. If not on a workspace level then on at least a project level.
fields.summary: Workspace Level Branch Permissions
